title: Full Stack Engineer II
description: Tech Stack: Node.js, Express.js, React.js, MongoDB, Jest, Azure
list: Quickly learned a large codebase in order to develop new RESTful endpoints as well as improve existing routes.
Connected to internal and external APIs using OAuth 2.0 as well as transitioning team from depreciated Auth technologies.
Uses LaunchDarkly to separate code releases from feature releases. This enables safer deployment with increased release agility and decreased risk.
Became top developer within a year, to be the development contact for the team while lead developer is unavailable.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description: Workout log built using React Native
list: Developed attractive Mobile front-end using React Native.
Implemented State management using Zustand, to make for a quick and efficient front-end.
Using RESTful techniques, integrated Data from an external API as well as made calls to Node.js backend
Integrated Node.js Backend to manage user-data and enable data persistence through a MongoDB Database

title: Back-End Engineer
description: API Router and Database built using speed-oriented architecture
list: Improved request throughput from 4 requests/sec to upward of 400 requests/sec by implementing NGINX load balancers to horizontally scale server requests to the AWS EC2 instances.
Lowered Query execution time from over 200ms down to under 1ms execution time in PostgreSQL by implementing aggregate queries, and foreign key indexes.
Decreased Stress Testing cycle length by using Loader.io to identify and revise bottlenecks

title: Front-End Engineer
description: Product-page for Clothing manufacturer, I implemented the Related Items and Your Outfit Carousels
list: Styled component using styled-components to allow for clean modulated code within React components
Allowed user to save products by implementing local Storage to enable data persistence.
Integrated state management using Zustand to reduce api calls and React component re renders
Implemented comparison modal using react-modal to allow side-by-side rendering of API data
